item.title: JavaScript: The Lingua Franca of the Web
item.description: Introduction JavaScript, conceived in the nets of Netscape Navigator and birthed by Brendan Eich in 1995, has metamorphosed from a fledgling scripting language to the backbone of modern web development. Its journey from an auxiliary tool to a pivotal force in the digital realm mirrors the web’s own evolution. The Genesis of JavaScript In the early days of the web, user experiences were static. Netscape envisioned a dynamic future and tasked Brendan Eich with creating a language that could breathe life into static HTML.
